newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU has 2.6 mln tns grain in intervention stocks.
newsitem.headline: EU has 2.6 mln tns grain in intervention stocks.

text.p: PARIS, April 1 (Reuter ) - The European Union had 2.6 million tonnes of grain, mostly barley, in its intervention stores as of March 1, its lowest level in twenty years, French maize growers association (AGPM) said.
This included 1.3 million tonnes of barley, 800,000 tonnes of oats and 500,000 tonnes of soft wheat, AGPM said in its monthly report.
Germany held the bulk of the grain or 2.4 million tonnes in its stores.
The European Commission has not officially released any data on the status of its intervention stocks. The campaign ends on June 30, 1997.
The European Union had grain intervention stocks of 2.8 million tonnes at end June 1996 and of 9.2 million tonnes at end June 1995.
